body: Just out of curiosity, how did this server go from 1000 people, then 300-500, and now 50?
body_tagged: Just out of curiosity, how did this server go from 1000 people, then 300-500, and now 50?
title: What Happened?

replies.body: Bad choices all around. Staff, gameplay, lack of ads, lag, etc.
replies.body_tagged: Bad choices all around. Staff, gameplay, lack of ads, lag, etc.

replies.body: because nexus and cth are offline right now

replies.body:
Because of the stultification of naive administrators and the good ones already left. Main problems were block lag, removal of prestiges, removal of many great gamemodes and the modernization which led to the complete downfall of the server. With Minecraft having shit updates, it even made the situation better for players to leave, so it's not only the server's fault.

@Devs: We don't want new great stuff, we want the old good stuff. That's the reason why we used to play on this server!

EDIT: The abusive part of staff and they're sometimes bad behaviour in non-avicus platforms are terrible too.
A good example is right beneath me ^^

replies.body:
Dear Howsie, I wrote you but you still ain't calling
I left the player count, the server, and my promotion at the bottom
Two admins got demoted back in autumn, you must not-a saw 'em
There probably was a problem in the staff departments or something
Sometimes I scribble policies too sloppy when I jot 'em
but anyways; Howsie, what's been up? Man how's your day been?
My rants in Avicus Lounge, too, I understand your problem
If I have a daughter, guess what I'ma call her? I'mma name her Pinkie
I read about your demotion, too, I'm sorry
I had a senior mod retire over some exams who did a bother
I know you probably hear this everyday, but I'm your biggest fan
I even remember your christmas lobby and your head in the library

replies.body:
1 or 2 people have slagged avicus off and said how shit it was in this post and I don't even think they play it anymore lol

Also has positivity helped the server so far? Yeah it has, it bought its player count down from respectable numbers to 50 on a good day. The gameplay is good but the staff is disorganised as fuck and has only gotten worse. Keep thinking positive and assume that shit is coming and the server will die out, that's exactly what happened to mcpvp.

replies.body:
1. "Also has positivity helped the server so far? Yeah it has, it bought its player count down from respectable numbers to 50 on a good day." Then how has it helped it? Just saying. 
  2. We're not as "disorganised" as people seem to believe. 
  3. Finally, if everyone begins slagging off the server at every opportunity, then many of the people will just get sick of the negativity and leave the server, and then it will truly die.

replies.body:
<sarcasm> The people "trying to keep it alive" are doing a swell job! </sarcasm>

I personally stopped playing the server a few months ago, but I don't want to see it die. Atdit is most likely the same way. We saw when it was great then watched as it slowly crumbled away into a shadow of its former self. 50 players max isn't enough to keep this server around for ever. Drama has killed it, too many shit admins that started doing one thing then left before it was completed. Once Atlas gets here and advertising picks up (hopefully) then there might be a change.

But in the meantime, start looking for YouTubere that have large audiences to create a slightly larger playerbase. :-:

replies.body:
You need to create a normal gameplay that people will enjoy playing. From personal experience, most people won't actually stick to a server that their youtuber plays, unless it's good. If it won't be good, players will just come on once their youtuber is on. But we need to make them stay. I've noticed that many randies really dislike several maps because some of them are confusing af. where is the weekly thread about removel and changing of maps? that was a great idea and gave the community the opportuinity to pick the map they like by a majority vote. also, advertise the thread on the broadcast so randies can vote too. maps are not only thing.
staff didn't improve imo, they stayed as. admins left wayyy too frequently and stupid decisions were made all over. ive always seen this as an issue, idk why, but i feel this is the actually one of our biggest issues right now: we have 3 admins, and all 3 of them HAVE TO BE involved with everything. im sorry, but you cant have funky dedicated to only dev work. ik hes busy af, but from when i was staff too ive noticed he doesnt wanna get involved in staff work etc and staff demotions. meanwhile hes the only person we call all trust to do the right decision, he leaves it for other admins. like in paras demotion, senior staff team decided to demote him. in a demotion of an admin, FUNKY AND ONLY FUNKY should be involved. all 3 admins need to be aware of all aspects of the servers: dev work (doesnt mean they have to know how to code), staff demotions promotions, im sorry funky but imo you really do need to take part in all that, ik how much youre busy.
replies.body_tagged:

staff didn't improve imo, they stayed as. admins left wayyy too frequently and stupid decisions were made all over. ive always seen this as an issue, idk why, but i feel this is the actually one of our biggest issues right now: we have 3 admins, and all 3 of them HAVE TO BE involved with everything. im sorry, but you cant have funky dedicated to only dev work. ik hes busy af, but from when i was staff too ive noticed he doesnt wanna get involved in staff work etc and staff demotions. meanwhile hes the only person we call all trust to do the right decision, he leaves it for other admins. like in paras demotion, senior staff team decided to demote him. in a demotion of an admin, FUNKY AND ONLY FUNKY should be involved. all 3 admins need to be aware of all aspects of the servers: dev work (doesnt mean they have to know how to code), staff demotions promotions, im sorry funky but imo you really do need to take part in all that, ik how much youre busy.

replies.body:
1. Exactly my point - sarcasm intensifies 
2. You are from what everyone has seen and experienced, if you truly were organised we would've seen it but it doesn't seem that way at all. There are people in my teamchat who are moderators themselves who even agree with me on this one.
3. The way I see it avicus is already a corpse just not fully decayed. The positivity hasn't exactly helped people stay has it now? More of the hope that avicus will become great again has tbh. Not saying this one for myself as I couldn't care less about this but I find it funny when people say to stop being so negative especially when many are the complete opposite. It literally is what I read on mcpvp a couple of months before it died lol

replies.body:
1. Sarcasm isn't exactly easy to interpret through a screen. It's almost as if they're just words on a screen that you can't tell apart from sincere sentences...Oh wait.
  2. I'm not saying that the team isn't disorganised. If you look at what I said, I clearly said we're not as disorganised as some think.
  3. I'm not saying that optimism will cause the server to improve. I'm saying that pessimistic comments don't help in any way, shape or form.

replies.body:
1. ??? Profit. It was quite obvious I was being sarcastic. You don't need to be a genius to be able to tell that considering the context.
2. So... you are saying that the team is disorganised but organised to an extent? Pick one side, in your opinion is the staff team organised or disorganised? You responding in this way just shows how disorganised the staff team is. You can't even tell us that the staff is organised, it hasn't been for nearly 2 years, people have a right to complain at you and be negative.
3. They should do. The negative comments raise concerns and deliver a message much better than the positive ones. It is up to the staff how these points are then tackled, and you obviously don't tackle them well otherwise people wouldn't be complaining about the same shit for months/years.

replies.body:
1. No, it's not very clear. It's why people tend to only use sarcasm in person, and not on a keyboard unless the sarcasm is explicit. Since this is petty and irrelevant, I'm just going to drop this.
  2. I'm saying that while the staff team is far from the most organised system in the world (trust me, I know) but the way some players describe it they make it seem as if no decisions are ever made.
  3. As I'm not a senior or an admin, there's a limit to how much I can do to address these points. However, comments such as "1 step: Demote yourself. Thanks" aren't just lacking in constructive criticism, they also just serve as a reminder to staff members that no matter what they do, some players will also criticise them and act as if everything is their fault.

3. They should do. The negative comments raise concerns and deliver a message much better than the positive ones. It is up to the staff how these points are then tackled, and you obviously don't tackle them well otherwise people wouldn't be complaining about the same shit for months/years.

replies.body:
"There isn't democracy"
 Posighdun
Soooo... no votes and no changes. And vote system won't help, cause only regulars will vote. But there are a lot of other people in the world. These potential players come to server, see all that not changing shit and leave. Forever.
Staff have to decide to remove/rebuild old stalemate maps.
But no. Why, what for. We just keep them and close our eyes to not see defects. And ignore suggestions and help. Because there isn't democracy. We can kill the server by ourself. dot.
replies.body_tagged:
"There isn't democracy"
 Posighdun
Soooo... no votes and no changes. And vote system won't help, cause only regulars will vote. But there are a lot of other people in the world. These potential players come to server, see all that not changing shit and leave. Forever.
Staff have to decide to remove/rebuild old stalemate maps.
But no. Why, what for. We just keep them and close our eyes to not see defects. And ignore suggestions and help. Because there isn't democracy. We can kill the server by ourself. dot.

reply_to.body:
You need to create a normal gameplay that people will enjoy playing. From personal experience, most people won't actually stick to a server that their youtuber plays, unless it's good. If it won't be good, players will just come on once their youtuber is on. But we need to make them stay. I've noticed that many randies really dislike several maps because some of them are confusing af. where is the weekly thread about removel and changing of maps? that was a great idea and gave the community the opportuinity to pick the map they like by a majority vote. also, advertise the thread on the broadcast so randies can vote too. maps are not only thing.
staff didn't improve imo, they stayed as. admins left wayyy too frequently and stupid decisions were made all over. ive always seen this as an issue, idk why, but i feel this is the actually one of our biggest issues right now: we have 3 admins, and all 3 of them HAVE TO BE involved with everything. im sorry, but you cant have funky dedicated to only dev work. ik hes busy af, but from when i was staff too ive noticed he doesnt wanna get involved in staff work etc and staff demotions. meanwhile hes the only person we call all trust to do the right decision, he leaves it for other admins. like in paras demotion, senior staff team decided to demote him. in a demotion of an admin, FUNKY AND ONLY FUNKY should be involved. all 3 admins need to be aware of all aspects of the servers: dev work (doesnt mean they have to know how to code), staff demotions promotions, im sorry funky but imo you really do need to take part in all that, ik how much youre busy.

replies.body:
well I'm going to give some constructive feedback to what avicus should do hope this actually gets looked at and reviewed:

-bring back the map community forum post that eric brought up - that was a pretty good way of putting up maps and seeing if they are good or bad or need removing or keeping
-keep competitive going; 20 teams this tournament is pretty good considering before there were a max of 8-10 teams if you keep the competitive going trust me you will see an increase of players overtime
-dedicated staff that are actually willing to contribute instead of just being there because they have to as it is their job
-better maps i'm sorry to those map makers but try make some good quality maps by adding some good features such as like different ways for different objectives etc. maps are decentish right now however we need a varied of maps as players will just get bored of the repeated ones that we have essentially played for for over 6 months.

also stop arguing between one another it's just not really needed and what we need to do is help each other in the community but if you can't do that then nobody can do anything to contribute

-keep competitive going; 20 teams this tournament is pretty good considering before there were a max of 8-10 teams if you keep the competitive going trust me you will see an increase of players overtime
-dedicated staff that are actually willing to contribute instead of just being there because they have to as it is their job
-better maps i'm sorry to those map makers but try make some good quality maps by adding some good features such as like different ways for different objectives etc. maps are decentish right now however we need a varied of maps as players will just get bored of the repeated ones that we have essentially played for for over 6 months.

also stop arguing between one another it's just not really needed and what we need to do is help each other in the community but if you can't do that then nobody can do anything to contribute

replies.body:
So this is why I don't play anymore:
- The main reason is it's boring, it's the same repetitive game every single time with little challenge etc...
- The staff are completely biased, don't commit to anything and well don't listen (for example no one cared whatsoever about my feedback in my leaving post)
- Lack of updates, hardly any updates happen at all, you need to have more smaller updates to keep players interested not waiting 12+ months for one update...
- This server is dead now, it can be revived IF there are a set of admins who are willing to really push the boat out and sort this place out, by that I mean committing ALOT of time to the network by taking onboard criticism and sorting out the situation. Quite frankly I believe that won't happen so yeah this server = dead.

*rant done, prepares for no notice to be taken*

replies.body:
If you're going to quote someone to prove a point. Make sure the quote is correct. Otherwise you look like a complete moron.

Posighdun said "This isn't a democracy" in response to people who were complaining that regulars weren't getting a say when threads were being locked.

Players getting a say as to whether threads should be locked or not is just fucking stupid. But let me get back to my point.

If you don't know the context of a quote AND get that quote wrong, your point of invalid and you look like an idiot.

Posighdun said "this isn't a democracy" in regards to that specific situation, not in regards to all server activity.

So do some research before you quote something you only vaguely remember.

So do some research before you quote something you only vaguely remember.

replies.body:
Again, you've taken it out of context.

It was a response for the scenario if the community was not ok if a thread was locked despite off topic arguments were being had on the thread.

Threads should be locked if off topic arguments take place. If people don't like that then tough.

That is why Posighdun said that "this isn't a democracy".

It wasn't his opinion on other players' opinions,
it was his opinion on why threads that contain off topic arguments should be locked regardless of how players personally feel.

Please try and understand the context of a quote before you misinterpret it and use it out of context.

"Tadaaa, gotcha"
replies.body_tagged:
Again, you've taken it out of context.

It was a response for the scenario if the community was not ok if a thread was locked despite off topic arguments were being had on the thread.

Threads should be locked if off topic arguments take place. If people don't like that then tough.

That is why Posighdun said that "this isn't a democracy".

It wasn't his opinion on other players' opinions,
it was his opinion on why threads that contain off topic arguments should be locked regardless of how players personally feel.

Please try and understand the context of a quote before you misinterpret it and use it out of context.

"Tadaaa, gotcha"

reply_to.body:
Hey, look, it is what admin (!) thinks about players' opinions. And it shows whole situation on server.
Tadaaaa, gotcha :D
He had to think before writing

replies.body: Actually he said that referring to the power of the mods in making decisions.
replies.body_tagged: Actually he said that referring to the power of the mods in making decisions.

reply_to.body:
If you're going to quote someone to prove a point. Make sure the quote is correct. Otherwise you look like a complete moron.

Posighdun said "This isn't a democracy" in response to people who were complaining that regulars weren't getting a say when threads were being locked.

Players getting a say as to whether threads should be locked or not is just fucking stupid. But let me get back to my point.

If you don't know the context of a quote AND get that quote wrong, your point of invalid and you look like an idiot.

Posighdun said "this isn't a democracy" in regards to that specific situation, not in regards to all server activity.

So do some research before you quote something you only vaguely remember.
